climbr 4.0.0
  • Reference

Reference

All functions

CleanAscents()

Tidies a raw ascents table.

FetchJsonAscentsFromApi()

Downloads ascent data from theCrag's paginated ascent facet API.

GetContingencyTable()

Returns the contingency table for a binary classifier

GetOutliers()

Generates outlier labels for the route plot.

IsTickClean()

Classifies tick types into a logical indicating whether the ascent was clean.

MakeWhrModel()

Creates a caret model object for fitting climbing ratings.

MergeWithRatings()

Updates the data frames in "dfs" with ratings results.

NormalizeTables()

Normalizes ascents to ascent, page and route tables.

ParseJsonAscents()

Parses ascent data from JSON responses as returned by theCrag's ascent facet API.

PlotPrecisionRecall()

Plots precision vs recall given predicted probabilities of clean ascents.

PlotProgression()

Plots the timeseries of rating estimates for a set of climbers.

PlotRatingsDensity()

Plots the ratings distribution for pages and routes.

PlotRouteRating()

Plots conventional grades vs the estimated "natural rating" of routes. Outliers are labeled.

PlotSelectedRoutes()

Plots (1 - alpha) confidence intervals for a set of routes.

PredictBradleyTerry()

Returns the probability an ascent is clean according to the Bradley-Terry model.

ReadAllJsonAscents()

Reads all ascent JSON in directory "dir".

ReadLogbook()

Reads a CSV export of a climber's logbook from theCrag.

ReadLogbooks()

Reads all logbooks in a directory. Logbook filenames are assumed to be in the format generated by theCrag, i.e. "climber-logbook-YYYY-MM-DD.csv".

ReadRatings()

Read ratings results from "dir".

SaveNormalizedTablesAsRDS()

Writes normalized tables in full to an RDS file.

SummarizeAscents()

Summarizes ascents data.

TransformGrade()

Performs a transformation of a grade to a natural rating.

WienerSmooth()

Returns an object of class WienerSmooth. This class supports the predict() generic function.

WriteNormalizedTables()

Writes normalized tables to CSV files with standard names.

predict(<WienerSmooth>)

Implements the stats::predict() generic function for WienerSmooth.

stat_wiener_smooth()

Returns a ggplot2 layer that by default renders a confidence band for a WHR rating over time.

Contents
